“What would you say about living here? Then you would have access to FRIDAY all the time, the lab, Bruce and.. me”

Tony looked up to meet her gaze, where a smile was playing on her lips.

“I would like that, and getting to know you a bit better”

This time it was Tony’s time to smile and he gave her a gentle pat on the shoulder before picking up his pace again.

“Great! I will have Happy pick up your bags, now let’s go get some food into that system of yours”

The Avengers kitchen was, as expected, huge. Tony explained that they all shared it, even though there were multiple others scattered around the building.

As they stepped of the elevator Yn could smell the pasta on the stove. Only the smell made her stomach let out loud noises and she blushed a little because of it. Loud voices were echoing between the walls and Tony sent her a worried look, asking for permission to enter the room with the avengers there, which she replied to with a small nod.

“Hey guys” Tony said, walking confidently into the room with Y/n right behind him. The laughter died out and every pair of eyes were directed to the short girl behind him. Confusion were written over their foreheads and Tony eventually pointed to Y/n.

“This is my daughter, Y/n”

Sam was about to open his mouth and leave a snarky comment but Tony sent him a death stare and hissed a low “don’t” his way, making him hold up his hands in surrender.

”She’s seventeen and she’s going to live here with us now, and no, I had no idea I had a daughter until six hours ago” Tony stared intensely at Sam.

“Okay, great, glad we got that out of the way. What are you cooking?” He continued, walking up to Wanda who were stirring a deep read tomato sauce.

“Uhm, Stark” Natasha said.

“I don’t think we’re ready to leave the subject yet”

All eyes were still on Y/n were she stood as glued to the ground, once again fidgeting with the zipper of her hoodie.

“Yeah Stark, this is a truck you can’t stop with your suit” Clint added, making Tony furrow his brows at the mans try to be clever.

Without thinking, Y/n chimed into the discussion.

“Actually, that should not be possible. I saw the video of the the boy dressed in red and blue tights, and a human should not be able to stop a car going 40 miles an hour. Or have telepathic abilities. It defies all laws of physics, chemistry AND biology. It should not be possible”

Her eyes were quick to land on the floor again.

“I’m sorry, I’m so sorry”

She was interrupted by the blonde with the broad shoulders coming into the kitchen, holding a green apple in his hand.

“You better watch out, she’s a genius”

Y/n felt her cheeks getting hot as confused eyes flickered through the room.

”Are you ever going to introduce us?” Bucky said, getting Tony’s attention.

He licked the tomato sauce of his finger before standing next to Y/n. He carefully wrapped an arm around her shoulders, looking at her for permission. She nodded slightly, enjoying the small act of affection.

“Meet the avengers” Tony said sarcastically and let go of the girl, making Bucky roll his eyes at him before sending her a warm smile. He got out of his chair and held out his hand, which she shook lightly with a small smile.

“I’m James, but most people call me Bucky”

He let go of her and turned around, pointing to the other people crowded around the kitchen island.

“This is Sam, he’s an asshole” he said, making the man smirk mischievously. Bucky put no effort into replying, instead he just continued on.

“That’s Natasha, and she’s not as scary as she looks” he pointed to a small woman with a cold expression on her face, making her look intimidating.

“Clint is the one on the stool, Wanda is cooking and the tall one over there is Thor”

Y/n let out a smile.

“Thor? Almost as in the germanic mythology, son of Odin? The god of thunder?” she said jokingly.

This caught the tall man’s attention and he made his way to her with two long steps.

“Yes Miss Y/n. That is me”

Y/n looked up to him in confusion. Disbelief written over her face.

“Uhm, Okay”

Thor didn’t like how sceptical the girl was being, and he about to reach his arm out to call on Mjolnir before Tony stopped him.

“Okay, okay, we understand. You’re the god of thunder and son of odin, bla bla bla”

He held his pointer finger out warningly.

“But don’t you break that window again, or else I will tell Loki that you are planning on betraying him”

Thor let out a huff before going back to his place around the table, sending Tony evil looks behind his back.

“Okay, dinners ready” Wanda said, a slight accent covering her words.

As the avengers flocked around the food, Y/n remained frozen to the ground, her father next to her.

“Hey, kid” he said, snapping her out her trans.

Her eyes met his, and she noticed the small worry wrinkle he had in his forehead.

“You alright?”

Y/n nodded slightly, swallowing thickly.

“Just a lot of people”

Tony looked at her with kind eyes.

“Grab some food and I’ll show you to your room, how about that?”

Y/n nodded and a wave of relief washed over her as she carefully put some pasta on her plate and drenched it in the red tomato sauce.

Tony gave her a smile as he grabbed his plate as well and went back to the elevator, Y/n following close by.

“FRIDAY, take us to floor six”

The elevator started moving and Y/n held a tighter grib on her plate as in a reflex.

“I live on the seventh , so I’m only a floor away if you need me” The man started, taking a bite of pasta into his mouth.

As the elevator came to a halt, he quickly swallowed to retrain his speech ability.

“There is only two rooms here, yours and our friendly neighborhood spiderman's”

As he saw the confused look on the girls face he explained further.

”The guy in red-and-blue tights catching the car”

”Oh”

Y/n said, letting the pieces fall into place. And Tony couldn’t help but be a little confused at her knowledge, the one that wasn’t there, about the avengers.

He unlocked the door and stood to the side, letting Y/n walk in first. The apartment was beautiful. Easily decorated like the rest of the building, but there were gold details added here and there, giving it an expensive and luxurious look.

“Holy shit Tony!”

She breathed out, speechless at the realization that this room, the one with the large flat screen tv and bathtub big enough to fit two of her, was in fact hers. It was more than she had ever had in her entire life, heck, the room was bigger than the houses she had lived in growing up.

Tony smiled at her, his heart growing bigger as he noticed the small things they had in common. Like the way she held her hands out when she was surprised, to the signature eye roll that Tony rocked every day.

In the eight hours he had spent together with her, knowing that he had a daughter, it was like he had become a different man. In only eight hours she had showed him a new kind of happiness and in only eight hours, he knew that he loved the girl almost running around inside of the apartment.

Meanwhile, three floors downstairs, most of the avengers were gathered in the big living room. They had all finished their dinner and were now sitting in silence.

“What is up with Stark today?” Clint finally said, breaking the icy silence.

“I don’t know, he is like a completely different person” Sam spoke.

“You know that he haven’t insulted me once since she got here” Steve continued.

“He’s almost nice” Natasha said, getting the attention of the many super heroes.

“What is that girl doing to him?” Steve almost whispered, voice laced in concern.

“Oh, cut it out guys. He’s happy. I haven’t seen him like this since he and Pepper still were a thing. Let him be”

Bucky pointed to Rhodey as the older man spoke.

“He’s got a point. Plus the whiskey bottles haven’t been touched since yesterday”

“But what do we think of her?” Wanda suddenly said.

Thor grunted and they all rolled their eyes at him.

“We know! We can’t believe how she doubted that you were the god of thunder and that you come from an entirely different planet!” Sam added sarcastically.

“She’s AMAZING” a voice yelled from the kitchen, and into the living room came Bruce. He had a burrito in his hand and a little mayonnaise on his cheek. His glasses were sitting a little crooked on his nose and he looked like he hadn’t gone outside for a week. Which he probably hadn’t either.

“You know that equation I haven’t been able to solve for like a week?” he continued as he sat down next to Nat on the grey couch.

The avengers sighed, not wanting to be remembered of his never ending complaining about that stupid equation.

Bruce raised a brow at their reaction before going back to talking.

“She solved it in like five minutes! Steve was there!”

The eyes were turned to Steve who nodded honestly.

“It’s true, she’s a genius. All it took for her was a look at the board and she had it all figured out, she’s a living calculator”

The heroes all shared puzzled looks, not knowing what to think about the girl, as Bruce went on about some airplane he was working on.

But they had one thing clear, if she was able to stop Tony from drinking his brains out a Tuesday morning at nine am, she was worth a chance.

-

Y/n and Tony sat around the white table in her room, eating their pasta in a comfortable silence.

Y/n looked at her father as he was eating, surprised by how calm he had been about this entire thing. She had expected him to throw her out with five grand in her hand and begging her to never come back, instead he had taken her in. He wasn’t at all the arrogant asshole everyone said he was, he was kind and caring and just wanted the best for everyone.

She hadn’t known him for very long but she could hear her mother’s words ringing in the back of her head. They really had a lot in common. She had his nose and defined cheekbones, and the unusual hairline.

He noticed her staring and looked up to meet her glassy eyes.

“You okay honey?”

She nodded as she placed her fork on her empty plate, pushing it slightly to the side.

“Thank you”

Tony looked at her with confusion dripping from his expression.

“For what?”

“For this, for everything. For taking me in and showing me all these things and introducing me to all these people”

The man smiled big, a genuine one that stretched out his lips.

“Oh, it’s nothing. I’m just trying to provide for you and make up for all the years I’ve missed of your life”

Y/n returned his smile and looked down on the white table, suppressing the burning sensation behind her eyelids.

“No, but really. I’m so grateful for everything and if you would have shut me out- i don’t know what I would do”

She swallowed thickly.

“I don't’ think I would still be here”

Tony’s smile faded as he heard the words, and even further down sunk his lips as he saw the tear roll down her cheek. She quickly wiped it away, trying to hide the fact that she was, as well as him, broken. He knew the feeling too well and knew how hard- almost hopeless it was.

He got out of his chair and sat down on the one next to her. It was like something parental kicked in, that caused him to wrap his arms around the girl and pull her tightly to his chest. She froze for a moment, before relaxing and melting into him. He held her shaking frame close, and his heart ached. She was all on her own, and had been since her mother passed. He had no idea how she had made it through, but he knew that she was strong, so strong.

“It’ll be okay, just breathe alright?” He said softly, feeling her chest rise and sink at his words.

“Sir, there is people at the door” FRIDAY called out in the speakers.

“Not now FRIDAY” Tony said, still holding the girl in his arms.

“But Mr-“

“Not now” He wheezed.

“It’s an emergency sir” FRIDAY spoke.

Tony sighed deeply, feeling the rage pumping through his veins. He had barely had time to be sassy, yet angry the entire day, and the feeling felt strange.

He slowly let go of Y/n, wiping a tear away from her cheek with his thumb before sending her a soft smile through gritted teeth. She let out a few soft sniffles as she wiped her nose with her sleeve, patting her eyes dry.

Tony looked up into the roof.

“FRIDAY, what’s the emergency?”

“The FBI are at the door, sir”

“And they are asking for Y/n”

“FRIDAY, where’s Banner?” Tony asked.

The woman’s voice echoed in the elevator, starling Y/n once again.

“Mr Banner is in the laboratory”

“Then that’s where we’re going”

The elevator started moving at his words and Y/n gave him a concerned look, holding a firm grip around the the metal handles.

“Banner? As in Dr Bruce Banner?”

Tony looked at her for a second, surprised at her knowledge.

“Yes, that’s the one”

He saw her pupils widened and a small smile creeping its way onto her lips, and even though she tired to hide it, her entire face showed of the anticipation.

Tony smirked at the sight as the elevator came to a stop and he quickly got out. He opened his arms and pointed out over the room.

“This is where the magic happens”

Y/n was as in a trans as she tried to take in the outstanding laboratory. It was like nothing she had ever seen before, and she had been to a fair share of labs in her lifetime.

“This is amazing” she mumbled as she nearly tripped over herself, making her cheeks crimson as she desperately grabbed onto a table to keep steady. Tony gave her a small smile as he moved further into the room, Y/n tight in his heels.

In the middle of the room, there was a large hologram projected over a big table. A middle aged man with a white coat and black glasses stood leaned over it, completely focused on what he was doing.

“Banner?” Tony said, trying to get the man’s attention.

He repeated his question as he snapped his fingers.

“Banner?”

The man shook his head slightly before looking at him.

“Oh, I didn’t hear you”

Tony raised his eyebrows a little.

“Noticed that much”

Bruce’s eyes flickered from Tony to the girl standing next to him, making a wrinkle appear between his brows.

“Who’s this?”

Y/n could barely contain her excitement, and she nervously fidgeted with the zipper on her hoodie.

“This is Y/n, my daughter” Tony said casually, walking around the hologram and examining it carefully. Bruce’s jaw dropped to the ground, being the third one of the day.

“W- What? Tony- since when?”

“Apparently since 2001, what is this?” He said, his entire attention dedicated to the hologram.

Bruce shot the girl a sceptical look before turning back to his experiment.

“I’m working on the new airplane design we discussed, the one that was only going to run on renewable energy sources, but it’s difficult to make it completely independent on fossil fuels”

Tony turned on the design and stroke his chin.

“Well if-“

Y/n took a step forward, looking over the blueprint as well.

“Why don’t you just combine different energy sources? Like making it run mostly from biofuels, but adding solar panels and electricity driven motors? You need to start out small though, there isn’t enough technology to make full airplane sized electric motors without making the entire city blackout. Also, you can also try taking advance of the wind, that is another very powerful energy source that you always will have access to, so the faster you fly, the more energy is created. But then you have..”

She trailed of, getting lost in her head. Bruce stared at her for a second only to turn his eyes to Tony, who looked stupidly proud.

“How?-“

Tony only shook his head, watching as his daughter intensely ran some math through her head, and watching her sigh happily as she figured it out.

She had been so quiet until now, where she seemed to be able to go on for eternities about what she was passionate about, and it hurt him a little seeing as she probably never had anyone to discuss these kinds of things with before.

She quickly took a piece of paper out of her black jeans and scribbled something down in a messy handwriting.

Y/n looked pleased with herself before she noticed the two people staring, and her cheeks grew a rosy color.

“I’m sorry I just-“ she stuttered but was interrupted by Bruce.

“No! Don’t apologize. You actually have a point”

She smiled big at his sentence before she took a deep breath and a step closer to him.

“Dr Banner”

Bruce flinched slightly at the mention of ‘dr’ as most people only called him by his first name nowadays. Or the ‘Hulk’, which was a name he had come to dislike.

“I am such a huge fan of yours and I really loved your article on anti electron collisions, oh, and the lesson you held at my university. About biochemistry and the biological process of the evolution? It was amazing!”

Words and praises were falling out if Y/n’s mouth like they were running water and she was a leaking tap.

Bruce was stunned, to say the least, of the seventeen year olds advanced knowledge, and he could see where she had gotten it from. Tony stood in the other end of the round table, trying to cover up the cocky smirk that clad his lips.

“Thank you Y/n” Bruce replied with a genuine smile. He was used to getting praised but for other reasons, like turning into a green monster and saving the world from aliens, something the small girl in front of him seemed completely oblivious to.

“How come you are reading those kinds of articles? I mean, you’re seventeen”

Y/n shrugged her shoulder a little, feeling the increasing anxiety creep up on her.

“I don’t know Dr Banner, I guess i’m just naturally interested”

She flashed him a nervous smile, noticing that he subject made her uncomfortable, he decided not to further pressure her.

“Alright, but if you want something to do I would be happy to show you a new article I’m writing on”

Y/n’s face lit up.

“Really?”

Bruce nodded and y/n smiled so big the sides od her eyes were crinkling up.

Tony, who watched the entire thing, grew more fond of the girl by the seconds, and even though he had only known her for about three hours, she already had a special place in his heart. And he knew that if anything ever happened to her, blood would be spilt.

“It’ll be okay, just breathe alright?” He said softly, feeling her chest rise and sink at his words.

“Sir, there is people at the door” FRIDAY called out in the speakers.

“Not now FRIDAY” Tony said, still holding the girl in his arms.

“But Mr-“

“Not now” He wheezed.

“It’s an emergency sir” FRIDAY spoke.

Tony sighed deeply, feeling the rage pumping through his veins. He had barely had time to be sassy, yet angry the entire day, and the feeling felt strange.

He slowly let go of Y/n, wiping a tear away from her cheek with his thumb before sending her a soft smile through gritted teeth. She let out a few soft sniffles as she wiped her nose with her sleeve, patting her eyes dry.

Tony looked up into the roof.

“FRIDAY, what’s the emergency?”

“The FBI are at the door, sir”

“And they are asking for Y/n”

trail.content:
hello, here is part two to this. Also I just want to say that I’m not a scientist so some things might not make any sense haha. Enjoy, feedback is always appreciated and reblogs help me a lot!

→summary: Turns out that Tony Stark wasn’t the asshole people made of him.

→wc: 3566

Y/n followed her father through  the building, scanning her eyes in fascination at the expensive equipment it was decorated with. Tony noticed the way her mouth hung slightly agape and he couldn’t help but feel a little proud over his creation.

Every once in a while, he would stop and explain something. Describe the origin of said item or tell a funny story about another. Eventually they reached the elevators, who were entirely made out of glass, making Y/n desperatly grab onto the railing.

“FRIDAY, where’s Banner?” Tony asked.

The woman’s voice echoed in the elevator, starling Y/n once again.

“Mr Banner is in the laboratory”

“Then that’s where we’re going”

The elevator started moving at his words and Y/n gave him a concerned look, holding a firm grip around the the metal handles.

“Banner? As in Dr Bruce Banner?”

Tony looked at her for a second, surprised at her knowledge.

“Yes, that’s the one”

He saw her pupils widened and a small smile creeping its way onto her lips, and even though she tired to hide it, her entire face showed of the anticipation.

Tony smirked at the sight as the elevator came to a stop and he quickly got out. He opened his arms and pointed out over the room.

“This is where the magic happens”

Y/n was as in a trans as she tried to take in the outstanding laboratory. It was like nothing she had ever seen before, and she had been to a fair share of labs in her lifetime.

“This is amazing” she mumbled as she nearly tripped over herself, making her cheeks crimson as she desperately grabbed onto a table to keep steady. Tony gave her a small smile as he moved further into the room, Y/n tight in his heels.

In the middle of the room, there was a large hologram projected over a big table. A middle aged man with a white coat and black glasses stood leaned over it, completely focused on what he was doing.

“Banner?” Tony said, trying to get the man’s attention.

He repeated his question as he snapped his fingers.

“Banner?”

The man shook his head slightly before looking at him.

“Oh, I didn’t hear you”

Tony raised his eyebrows a little.

“Noticed that much”

Bruce’s eyes flickered from Tony to the girl standing next to him, making a wrinkle appear between his brows.

“Who’s this?”

Y/n could barely contain her excitement, and she nervously fidgeted with the zipper on her hoodie.

“This is Y/n, my daughter” Tony said casually, walking around the hologram and examining it carefully. Bruce’s jaw dropped to the ground, being the third one of the day.

“W- What? Tony- since when?”

“Apparently since 2001, what is this?” He said, his entire attention dedicated to the hologram.

Bruce shot the girl a sceptical look before turning back to his experiment.

“I’m working on the new airplane design we discussed, the one that was only going to run on renewable energy sources, but it’s difficult to make it completely independent on fossil fuels”

Tony turned on the design and stroke his chin.

“Well if-“

Y/n took a step forward, looking over the blueprint as well.

“Why don’t you just combine different energy sources? Like making it run mostly from biofuels, but adding solar panels and electricity driven motors? You need to start out small though, there isn’t enough technology to make full airplane sized electric motors without making the entire city blackout. Also, you can also try taking advance of the wind, that is another very powerful energy source that you always will have access to, so the faster you fly, the more energy is created. But then you have..”

She trailed of, getting lost in her head. Bruce stared at her for a second only to turn his eyes to Tony, who looked stupidly proud.

“How?-“

Tony only shook his head, watching as his daughter intensely ran some math through her head, and watching her sigh happily as she figured it out.

She had been so quiet until now, where she seemed to be able to go on for eternities about what she was passionate about, and it hurt him a little seeing as she probably never had anyone to discuss these kinds of things with before.

She quickly took a piece of paper out of her black jeans and scribbled something down in a messy handwriting.

Y/n looked pleased with herself before she noticed the two people staring, and her cheeks grew a rosy color.

“I’m sorry I just-“ she stuttered but was interrupted by Bruce.

“No! Don’t apologize. You actually have a point”

She smiled big at his sentence before she took a deep breath and a step closer to him.

“Dr Banner”

Bruce flinched slightly at the mention of ‘dr’ as most people only called him by his first name nowadays. Or the ‘Hulk’, which was a name he had come to dislike.

“I am such a huge fan of yours and I really loved your article on anti electron collisions, oh, and the lesson you held at my university. About biochemistry and the biological process of the evolution? It was amazing!”

Words and praises were falling out if Y/n’s mouth like they were running water and she was a leaking tap.

Bruce was stunned, to say the least, of the seventeen year olds advanced knowledge, and he could see where she had gotten it from. Tony stood in the other end of the round table, trying to cover up the cocky smirk that clad his lips.

“Thank you Y/n” Bruce replied with a genuine smile. He was used to getting praised but for other reasons, like turning into a green monster and saving the world from aliens, something the small girl in front of him seemed completely oblivious to.

“How come you are reading those kinds of articles? I mean, you’re seventeen”

Y/n shrugged her shoulder a little, feeling the increasing anxiety creep up on her.

“I don’t know Dr Banner, I guess i’m just naturally interested”

She flashed him a nervous smile, noticing that he subject made her uncomfortable, he decided not to further pressure her.

“Alright, but if you want something to do I would be happy to show you a new article I’m writing on”

Y/n’s face lit up.

“Really?”

Bruce nodded and y/n smiled so big the sides od her eyes were crinkling up.

Tony, who watched the entire thing, grew more fond of the girl by the seconds, and even though he had only known her for about three hours, she already had a special place in his heart. And he knew that if anything ever happened to her, blood would be spilt.

-

The day passed by in high speed and Y/n and her father found themselves bonding pretty quickly. They shared a lot of interests and both of them had a fascinating obsession with technology. Y/n began opening up a little to him, feeling the most comfortable she had felt since her mother passed. It was small things that crushed him a little inside like the way she was fascinated over the pool, and claiming she had never been to one. She was so innocent, yet she had been through so much.

After asking for some privacy, the rest of the avengers had left the girl and her father alone, although Tony was sure that he saw them in the corner of his eye at multiple occasions.

The clock was nearing 7 and he new that he was going to have to pop the question sooner or later.

”So…”

he started, making both of them stop in their tracks.

”Where are you staying?”

Y/n rubbed her palms together as she felt her stomach growl of hunger.

”Uhm, at the Colton Centre Hotel in the city. I just kinda packed everything I had and left”

Tony nodded understandingly, not wanting to pressure the fragile teenager.

“What would you say about living here? Then you would have access to FRIDAY all the time, the lab, Bruce and.. me”

Tony looked up to meet her gaze, where a smile was playing on her lips.

“I would like that, and getting to know you a bit better”

This time it was Tony’s time to smile and he gave her a gentle pat on the shoulder before picking up his pace again.

“Great! I will have Happy pick up your bags, now let’s go get some food into that system of yours”

The Avengers kitchen was, as expected, huge. Tony explained that they all shared it, even though there were multiple others scattered around the building.

As they stepped of the elevator Yn could smell the pasta on the stove. Only the smell made her stomach let out loud noises and she blushed a little because of it. Loud voices were echoing between the walls and Tony sent her a worried look, asking for permission to enter the room with the avengers there, which she replied to with a small nod.

“Hey guys” Tony said, walking confidently into the room with Y/n right behind him. The laughter died out and every pair of eyes were directed to the short girl behind him. Confusion were written over their foreheads and Tony eventually pointed to Y/n.

“This is my daughter, Y/n”

Sam was about to open his mouth and leave a snarky comment but Tony sent him a death stare and hissed a low “don’t” his way, making him hold up his hands in surrender.

”She’s seventeen and she’s going to live here with us now, and no, I had no idea I had a daughter until six hours ago” Tony stared intensely at Sam.

“Okay, great, glad we got that out of the way. What are you cooking?” He continued, walking up to Wanda who were stirring a deep read tomato sauce.

“Uhm, Stark” Natasha said.

“I don’t think we’re ready to leave the subject yet”

All eyes were still on Y/n were she stood as glued to the ground, once again fidgeting with the zipper of her hoodie.

“Yeah Stark, this is a truck you can’t stop with your suit” Clint added, making Tony furrow his brows at the mans try to be clever.

Without thinking, Y/n chimed into the discussion.

“Actually, that should not be possible. I saw the video of the the boy dressed in red and blue tights, and a human should not be able to stop a car going 40 miles an hour. Or have telepathic abilities. It defies all laws of physics, chemistry AND biology. It should not be possible”

Her eyes were quick to land on the floor again.

“I’m sorry, I’m so sorry”

She was interrupted by the blonde with the broad shoulders coming into the kitchen, holding a green apple in his hand.

“You better watch out, she’s a genius”

Y/n felt her cheeks getting hot as confused eyes flickered through the room.

”Are you ever going to introduce us?” Bucky said, getting Tony’s attention.

He licked the tomato sauce of his finger before standing next to Y/n. He carefully wrapped an arm around her shoulders, looking at her for permission. She nodded slightly, enjoying the small act of affection.

“Meet the avengers” Tony said sarcastically and let go of the girl, making Bucky roll his eyes at him before sending her a warm smile. He got out of his chair and held out his hand, which she shook lightly with a small smile.

“I’m James, but most people call me Bucky”

He let go of her and turned around, pointing to the other people crowded around the kitchen island.

“This is Sam, he’s an asshole” he said, making the man smirk mischievously. Bucky put no effort into replying, instead he just continued on.

“That’s Natasha, and she’s not as scary as she looks” he pointed to a small woman with a cold expression on her face, making her look intimidating.

“Clint is the one on the stool, Wanda is cooking and the tall one over there is Thor”

Y/n let out a smile.

“Thor? Almost as in the germanic mythology, son of Odin? The god of thunder?” she said jokingly.

This caught the tall man’s attention and he made his way to her with two long steps.

“Yes Miss Y/n. That is me”

Y/n looked up to him in confusion. Disbelief written over her face.

“Uhm, Okay”

Thor didn’t like how sceptical the girl was being, and he about to reach his arm out to call on Mjolnir before Tony stopped him.

“Okay, okay, we understand. You’re the god of thunder and son of odin, bla bla bla”

He held his pointer finger out warningly.

“But don’t you break that window again, or else I will tell Loki that you are planning on betraying him”

Thor let out a huff before going back to his place around the table, sending Tony evil looks behind his back.

“Okay, dinners ready” Wanda said, a slight accent covering her words.

As the avengers flocked around the food, Y/n remained frozen to the ground, her father next to her.

“Hey, kid” he said, snapping her out her trans.

Her eyes met his, and she noticed the small worry wrinkle he had in his forehead.

“You alright?”

Y/n nodded slightly, swallowing thickly.

“Just a lot of people”

Tony looked at her with kind eyes.

“Grab some food and I’ll show you to your room, how about that?”

Y/n nodded and a wave of relief washed over her as she carefully put some pasta on her plate and drenched it in the red tomato sauce.

Tony gave her a smile as he grabbed his plate as well and went back to the elevator, Y/n following close by.

“FRIDAY, take us to floor six”

The elevator started moving and Y/n held a tighter grib on her plate as in a reflex.

“I live on the seventh , so I’m only a floor away if you need me” The man started, taking a bite of pasta into his mouth.

As the elevator came to a halt, he quickly swallowed to retrain his speech ability.

“There is only two rooms here, yours and our friendly neighborhood spiderman's”

As he saw the confused look on the girls face he explained further.

”The guy in red-and-blue tights catching the car”

”Oh”

Y/n said, letting the pieces fall into place. And Tony couldn’t help but be a little confused at her knowledge, the one that wasn’t there, about the avengers.

He unlocked the door and stood to the side, letting Y/n walk in first. The apartment was beautiful. Easily decorated like the rest of the building, but there were gold details added here and there, giving it an expensive and luxurious look.

“Holy shit Tony!”

She breathed out, speechless at the realization that this room, the one with the large flat screen tv and bathtub big enough to fit two of her, was in fact hers. It was more than she had ever had in her entire life, heck, the room was bigger than the houses she had lived in growing up.

Tony smiled at her, his heart growing bigger as he noticed the small things they had in common. Like the way she held her hands out when she was surprised, to the signature eye roll that Tony rocked every day.

In the eight hours he had spent together with her, knowing that he had a daughter, it was like he had become a different man. In only eight hours she had showed him a new kind of happiness and in only eight hours, he knew that he loved the girl almost running around inside of the apartment.

Meanwhile, three floors downstairs, most of the avengers were gathered in the big living room. They had all finished their dinner and were now sitting in silence.

“What is up with Stark today?” Clint finally said, breaking the icy silence.

“I don’t know, he is like a completely different person” Sam spoke.

“You know that he haven’t insulted me once since she got here” Steve continued.

“He’s almost nice” Natasha said, getting the attention of the many super heroes.

“What is that girl doing to him?” Steve almost whispered, voice laced in concern.

“Oh, cut it out guys. He’s happy. I haven’t seen him like this since he and Pepper still were a thing. Let him be”

Bucky pointed to Rhodey as the older man spoke.

“He’s got a point. Plus the whiskey bottles haven’t been touched since yesterday”

“But what do we think of her?” Wanda suddenly said.

Thor grunted and they all rolled their eyes at him.

“We know! We can’t believe how she doubted that you were the god of thunder and that you come from an entirely different planet!” Sam added sarcastically.

“She’s AMAZING” a voice yelled from the kitchen, and into the living room came Bruce. He had a burrito in his hand and a little mayonnaise on his cheek. His glasses were sitting a little crooked on his nose and he looked like he hadn’t gone outside for a week. Which he probably hadn’t either.

“You know that equation I haven’t been able to solve for like a week?” he continued as he sat down next to Nat on the grey couch.

The avengers sighed, not wanting to be remembered of his never ending complaining about that stupid equation.

Bruce raised a brow at their reaction before going back to talking.

“She solved it in like five minutes! Steve was there!”

The eyes were turned to Steve who nodded honestly.

“It’s true, she’s a genius. All it took for her was a look at the board and she had it all figured out, she’s a living calculator”

The heroes all shared puzzled looks, not knowing what to think about the girl, as Bruce went on about some airplane he was working on.

But they had one thing clear, if she was able to stop Tony from drinking his brains out a Tuesday morning at nine am, she was worth a chance.

-

Y/n and Tony sat around the white table in her room, eating their pasta in a comfortable silence.

Y/n looked at her father as he was eating, surprised by how calm he had been about this entire thing. She had expected him to throw her out with five grand in her hand and begging her to never come back, instead he had taken her in. He wasn’t at all the arrogant asshole everyone said he was, he was kind and caring and just wanted the best for everyone.

She hadn’t known him for very long but she could hear her mother’s words ringing in the back of her head. They really had a lot in common. She had his nose and defined cheekbones, and the unusual hairline.

He noticed her staring and looked up to meet her glassy eyes.

“You okay honey?”

She nodded as she placed her fork on her empty plate, pushing it slightly to the side.

“Thank you”

Tony looked at her with confusion dripping from his expression.

“For what?”

“For this, for everything. For taking me in and showing me all these things and introducing me to all these people”

The man smiled big, a genuine one that stretched out his lips.

“Oh, it’s nothing. I’m just trying to provide for you and make up for all the years I’ve missed of your life”

Y/n returned his smile and looked down on the white table, suppressing the burning sensation behind her eyelids.

“No, but really. I’m so grateful for everything and if you would have shut me out- i don’t know what I would do”

She swallowed thickly.

“I don't’ think I would still be here”

Tony’s smile faded as he heard the words, and even further down sunk his lips as he saw the tear roll down her cheek. She quickly wiped it away, trying to hide the fact that she was, as well as him, broken. He knew the feeling too well and knew how hard- almost hopeless it was.

He got out of his chair and sat down on the one next to her. It was like something parental kicked in, that caused him to wrap his arms around the girl and pull her tightly to his chest. She froze for a moment, before relaxing and melting into him. He held her shaking frame close, and his heart ached. She was all on her own, and had been since her mother passed. He had no idea how she had made it through, but he knew that she was strong, so strong.

“It’ll be okay, just breathe alright?” He said softly, feeling her chest rise and sink at his words.

“Sir, there is people at the door” FRIDAY called out in the speakers.

“Not now FRIDAY” Tony said, still holding the girl in his arms.

“But Mr-“

“Not now” He wheezed.

“It’s an emergency sir” FRIDAY spoke.

Tony sighed deeply, feeling the rage pumping through his veins. He had barely had time to be sassy, yet angry the entire day, and the feeling felt strange.

He slowly let go of Y/n, wiping a tear away from her cheek with his thumb before sending her a soft smile through gritted teeth. She let out a few soft sniffles as she wiped her nose with her sleeve, patting her eyes dry.

Tony looked up into the roof.

“FRIDAY, what’s the emergency?”

“The FBI are at the door, sir”

“And they are asking for Y/n”
